data.text: After a lovely morning out we decided to visit the Merlin for lunch. We haven‚Äôt been here for many years and it was nice to return. Our server was Brad and he was great. The food was hot, tasty and very filling. We felt we got a great amount for the price. I had a half roast chicken and my husband a beef pie. Both were delicious. There was plenty of seating both inside and out, we chose inside as respite from the heat. Plenty of menu options, we were spoilt for choice really. Nice country pub feel inside. We‚Äôll try not to leave it another 8 years before our next return!

The place is very nice and the food excellent. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately when we went they had ' over booked' . We had a table if a little small for six males but the staff were overstretched. For a meal booked at 1 we didn't really get served until 2 and they had lost our pre-booked order. So the prestige Christmas lunch was slightly tarnished and they kept forgetting the extras that offered. I guess such is Christmas time and my guests all enjoyed themselves. We didn't leave until 5 inpart because of the service but reflected our relaxed mood as well.
I give it 4 Star because everyone enjoyed the food which was very good.
Much better this year . All the good points none of the bad!

data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi S Alexanda, 

Thank you for taking the time to review your recent visit at The Merlin. The fresh Cod on our fish and chips dish is battered to order and deep fried, we then put a touch of rock salt on the top to enchance the flavour. This is the same with our skinny fries and chunky chips, we add salt to the chips before we send them out. This is common practice in the majority of restaurants.

I am pleased to hear we remedied the situation for you with no fuss.
The manageress is correct in stating if you don't want any extra salt on your dishes to inform us before ordering and we will ensure it comes out plain.

I do hope we will see you again soon and we will be awarded that elusive fith star!!!

Gary & Team Merlin

data.text:
I went for Sunday dinner with my daughter & grand daughter on 26 February & ordered 2 Roast Beef Dinners. These were served & the meat was raw, we attempted to eat the meat & struggled to even cut it as well as digesting it. The rest of the dinner was getting cold because of struggling with the meat. We finally got the attention of one of the young male food servers. They didn't take the plate of food away, they just came back with 2 slices of beef (1 slice each) which didn't replace the amount on the original dinner plate. Also were we expected to eat off the same plate which had the existing raw meat on it. Also
we were expected to eat the gravy & vegetables that was with the raw meat. We couldn't continue with the meal yet we paid half price for a meal we  couldn't eat.Also drinks for a afternoon family get together
that was a disaster. It spoilt the whole day.
The table was booked under my daughters  name Hewitt. I'd appreciate a response as I wouldn't like anyone else experiencing this.
data.name: Patricia Barrow
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Patricia Barrow,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are sorry to hear that the food quality was not up to the mark on this occasion, resulting in a disappointing experience. Please may we ask you to directly contact the manager on site, over telephone, in order to resolve the matter. Alternatively, you could fill out a feedback form through our website, enabling management to leave a direct response to your feedback. The Merlin do aim to meet high food service standards and hence, apologise we did not meet these expectations during your visit. We hope that you will give us another chance to show you what we are really capable of.

data.text: Staff very friendly but a bit useless. We had to ask for cutlery quite a few times (whilst our dinner going cold in front of us- they brought food but didn‚Äôt notice no cutlery and were gone before we could ask for it) We had to ask for drinks a number of times repeatedly. I asked for a drink for my daughter 5 times with 3 different people before we got it. The blackcurrant mousse which was ¬£7.50 was literally an inch square and didn‚Äôt come with anything it suggested it did on the menu. We had literally 6 different people all serving us - you‚Äôd ask one person for the wine list and they‚Äôd send someone different to help and they‚Äôd try to take a drinks order (but not having given us the wine list). Food itself was good. Main course was tasty but came about half an hour after the kids food. All in all I won‚Äôt be going back - about ¬£124 not well spent !

data.text: Very pleasant stay.ans great value.  They had run out of fillet steaks on the Saturday evening, which was a little disappointing, but they had a good selection if alternative evening meals and they more than made up for it with the excellent breakfasts the next morning.  Friendly staff, who worked hard to accommodate our needs as part of a large group attending a nearby wedding.  Held back one star because any noises in the hallway were clearly audible in the bedroom, including the groan of the floorboards as people walked past.  Still, I would be happy to stay there again, because the overall experience was so good.

data.text: It was an utter disappointment and not worth the money we paid for a Christmas Day dinner. We were given dessert spoons for soup and soup spoons for dessert, had food served in chipped bowls and barely any vegetables. The restaurant was like a sauna too. A lot of the items we were meant to get as stated on the menu which we had preselected and pre paid for did not even get included. We were missing certain veg, the rustic bread with the soup, the chocolates at the end for example. The children‚Äôs Xmas menu was basic and overall, the quality of the food was very basic and bland. Not worth the money we paid for it and left wishing we had stayed at home.

data.text:
I booked the family in for Christmas dinner this year instead of staying at home. What a disappointment this was from start to finish.
We were a family of four, 2 adults and 2 children. The starters arrived, no problem except I was served a dessert spoon for my soup and this came with no bread or offering of bread although on the menu it says it is served with bread. The main was a huge disappointment and I can only assume that there was a shortage of vegetables as we were given a small bowl of sprouts and green beans that was required to serve three, hardly the selection of festive vegetables we were expecting and is listed on the menu. I had the Vegan option which also came with no accompanying sides whatsoever and consisted of the Wellington and some broccoli, again no pur√©e that was listed on the menu. The desserts again were served with a mixture of dessert and soup spoons, and the bowl my youngest daughters dessert was served in was chipped, we also didn‚Äôt receive the Green & Blacks Chocolates listed  on the menu. Finally, where we were sat was like a sauna and even the waitress commented on how hot it was. All in all a poor experience, badly planned and presented and didn‚Äôt justify the price we paid which was around 400¬£ with drinks.

data.text: Disappointing first visit. The bar was closing early, no real ale and beer. Friendly service and well decorated.
data.name: Pete A
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thank you for letting us know about your recent visit to The Merlin. We are glad to hear that you found our service friendly. We have made a desicion as a business to not sell real ale as after doing lots of trials with different ales as it hasn't proven popular enough for us to sell it. If you also take into account the shelf life of ale (no longer than a week) we were finding a lot of wastage each week. I am very sorry to hear that on the night you were with us you feel we closed early. This is only done on very rare occasions and on these occasions we have to make this desicion to make outrselves viable as a business. This is typically only done on extremely quiet night with very minimal trade and will never be before 10:30pm.
Please accept our appologies. We hope to welcome you back again soon.
Brad

data.responseFromOwnerText:

We regret to hear that you unhappy with your recent visit to The Merlin. We are still a pub with a very busy restaurant and our Asahi Cube is very popular with functions.

We do have a large range of alternative beers, wines and spirits for our guests to enjoy.

Hopefully you can join us again soon for a different beverage.

Thank you for your feedback.

Gary & Team Merlin

We both ordered the Sunday Roast, price was good however when the meal came the beef was very tough and the whole meal was Luke warm on a cold plate. My mum unfortunately had to send hers back as the beef was too red for her, I‚Äôd definitely suggest asking  the customer how they prefer their meat to be cooked as they do in most restaurants serving Sunday roasts.
I had also ordered the Chocolate bomb Biscoff dessert and when it arrived was extremely disappointed and underwhelmed for a dessert that nearly cost ¬£8 I would have expected a big classic brownie with the chocolate bomb on top, not a chocolate shell with a rock hard piece of small cubed brownie and a teaspoon of Biscoff to go with?
I‚Äôve awarded a 5 out of 10 because the staff were polite. I‚Äôm so sorry this is the most negative review I‚Äôve written in a long time and don‚Äôt like writing them but felt quite strongly about this especially as I paid nearly ¬£30 and could of gone to the Ivy in Manchester on that budget

data.text:
This place has gone right down hill...

We used to live up the road until about 6 months ago and so used to eat here quite frequently. It was our kids favourite. Had dinner there yesterday and it was awful.
The starters were fine and came out reasonably soon, but we had to wait a further 45 mins for our main course. When the order came out, the order was incorrect and the food was dry and nowhere near the previous standards... The restaurant was about 50% full, so the kitchen was hardly flat out.
On top of that, the waitress (she was pretty much on her own serving) gave us incorrect info regarding my youngest's order (they no longer do nuggets and chips for kids) which led to a child meltdown... I don't blame her as she was so overworked. I suppose this is what "Taking back control" means in practical terms.
Also, there was virtually no sparking wine on the menu. Every time my wife ordered a drink, she was told that they didn't have in in stock. We were told that management had changed the entire menu just before Xmas and therefore it hadn't been restocked (????).

Overall we were extremely disappointed and won't be returning.

data.text: Rang before arriving to make sure dogs were allowed. We're told dogs are allowed in the bar area and that we could eat in the bar area. We asked if we needed to book a table but were told that was not necessary. Arrived around 15 minutes later. Waited a few minutes for someone to actually greet us, eventually a young guy came over and very abruptly asked us what we were waiting for. I asked which tables were OK to sit with the dogs and he said for drinks? and I said no food. He rudely and abruptly said unless you have booked a table you can't eat we are fully booked. There was hardly anyone in  both bar and restaurant and  only a couple of the tables in the bar area were occupied. We reiterated what the man on the phone told us only for him to start speaking to someone else. Used to really like it in here but not sure we would go again with the way we were spoken to.
data.name: Kerry Harvey
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Kerry Harvey, We're disappointed to hear of the negative experience you had at The Merlin. Unfortunatly there was a bit if mis communication between the managers on Sunday resulting in you bieng turned away. My collegue was mortified to read this review and in no way did want to come across abrupt and rude, indeed he is the opposite. Please accept my appologies for your experience on Sunday, as you have visited us many times before you know our standars are very high and this was just a one off blip in our standards.We do hope you will join us again for the standard of service you are used to on your previous visits.Gary & Team Merlin

data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Luis,Thanks for taking the time to write some feedback. I was working all day on Wednesday so was on duty when you came in. I certainly did not ‚Äòkick you out for no reason‚Äô and neither did any of my team. On a Wednesday we take last drink orders at 10.30pm and all guests must vacate at 11pm. This is the only reason we would ask you to leave and the accusation of xenophobia is unsubstantiated and very unfair. As you can well imagine we have multiple employees from outside of the UK working at The Merlin and to suggest that we are in anyway Xenophobic is unhelpful and damaging to our business. I would kindly ask you to retract your claims or remove your review.Many thanks Alex General Manager

data.text:
My daughter & I had an early lunch here today, it was very quiet, we could only see 2 other guests. We ordered food & drinks as soon as we sat down, after 20 mins I was wondering where the drinks were. The salad's we ordered came after about 30 mins, I asked for some salt & also asked where my drink was. They brought my daughters drink out.... still no sign of mine! When my Latte finally arrived (whilst I was eating my meal!) it was cold! The waitress came over about 10 mins after we had finished, she never bothered to ask if everything was ok, if she had I would have told her rather than writing a review. The Beef salad we had wasn't that impressive either, I definitely wouldn't recommend The Merlin.
Short description of our visit - Poor service, cold coffee & a huge disappointment!
data.name: Mel Whittaker
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Mel,Thank you for taking the time to review your visit to The Merlin.Please accept our appologies from the sub standard service you recieved from us and if you read all our other reviews you can see that this was an isolated occasion in our otherwise smooth sevice cycle.We do appreciate your review and we will bring up your comments in our next team meeting to ensure we never get a repeat of your visit. It is reviews like this that we act upon to help us build a better business.I do hope you will give us another visit and you will see the improvements that we will have made.Many Thanks,Gary & Team Merlin

data.text: Dined here for the first time for an anniversary and it was a mixed experience. Service was good and starters were great, but the lamb main was disappointing (overcooked, missing and wrong items on the plate). The outdoor ‚Äòatrium‚Äô area wasn‚Äôt comfy and is grubby (dogs allowed too) so dine inside if you can. May return but will try other venues nearby next time.

As you mentioned the restaurant is dog free, so you are more than welcome to dine there next time.I hope the above hasn't put you off too much and may choose to visit us again in future.Alex

data.text:
2 x Roast dinners.
Poor portions. 1 slice of beef on the roast beef, 1 slice of pork on the roast pork. Token roast root veg and only cabbage for "Greens".
On the other hand, Beautiful Roast potatoes and Lovely, fresh, home-made Yorkshire Puds, and great gravy.

The quality was good, I just don't expect  to leave the table Hungry after a Sunday Roast - both my wife and I did.
data.name: Colin Greensmith
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Colin,   Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your visit to The Merlin on Sunday. We are disappointed to hear that our roast dinners were not upto our usual portion size, I have discussed your comments with our kitchen team to ensure we have consistancy with the quantity of roasts.  I am pleased that the quality of the dinners were uto our usual high standard, nice fluffy roast potatoes, rich gravy and our Yorkshire puddings are hand made by our chefs.  I do hope you will yoin us again soon,  Many Thanks,  Gary & Team Merlin

Surely this meant the kitchen was already in full swing
data.name: Carol Boon

We serve breakfast and brunch Monday - Friday from 7am to mid-day and on Saturday and Sunday from 8am - Mid-day  I do hope you will return to find out how delicious our breakfasts are. data.text: Although the food was really tasty, the suday manu is dominated by fish. Not to my tast. If u dont want a roast, your choice is steak or burger. I had roast beef, most of it was veg. Beef was really good tho. More red meat dishes please.
data.name: Simon Manton
data.responseFromOwnerText: Dear Mr Maton,  Thank you for giving us some feedback on your experience with us here at The Merlin. On a Sunday the roast is our main focus which the majority of the guests do come to enjoy but as well as this we do try our best to offer a vast array of menu options to go along with these roasts. They include a delightful chicken and leek pie, a southern fried chicken stuffed with nduja sauasage to spice things up as well as an varitey of salads and as you mentioned a selection of burgers and steaks. We hope to see you again, maybe even during the week where our normal menu has an even greater selection of red meat dishes for you to enjoy.   Sinserly Harry and Team Merlin

data.text:
OK this is a response to Gary and the team about my recent Trip Advisor review.

You very skilfully avoided commenting on the fact that your car park is very poorly lit. None of us saw the signs. Yes there was something there, but It doesn‚Äôt‚Äô really matter if you have 15 or 150 signs if it‚Äôs so dark you can‚Äôt read them. Or I guess we are too elderly to notice. And speaking about elderly you should do a Risk Assessment of your car park area and you will realize it‚Äôs unsafe to use after dark. Fire department will tell you this. My opinion that is‚Ä¶.

As for the signs inside, I can‚Äôt really tell, I never went near the bar, but you don‚Äôt really pay attention, as I said it used to be free before and you will not notice a sign unless you are looking for it.

Yes, it was surprisingly easy to park, that was because the place was half empty on a Friday evening and no, we will not be coming back.
data.name: Theo Boukouris
data.responseFromOwnerText: Dear Less Grossman,  Primarily all these social platforms are for our guests to come and post their feed back on their experience with the food and service in the restaurant, not to complain about our new car parking policy.  Secondly your comment on the car park lighting was skipped over simply as it has no basis to stand on as we have multiple flood lights covering the car park illuminating the signs for people to see which is backed up by our 5* EHO (Environmental Health Office) rating, and I can assure you all our risk assessments required by law are all up to date.  Lastly instead of complaining on our social platforms, if you had got in touch with us by email or over the phone we could have dealt with the whole ordeal in a much more civilised manor, leading to the termination of the ticket if you simply could provide proof of purchase at our establishment and hence prove you had used our facilities.  Sincerely Gary and Team Merlin

data.text: I ordered steak, I was asked how I wanted it cooked to then be told a few minutes later they hadn't got any steak. My husband ordered the prawn, salmon and prawn starter and it was mainly just sauce. All through the meal we were noticing things missing off our meal that were advertised on the menu. We had no chestnuts with our sprouts, there was no sapphire with my salmon. We had to ask for our coffee that was included in a set menu, then we had to ask for the chocolates to go with it. This was disappointing as it was my birthday meal on boxing day. Then to add to the disappointment when we went down to breakfast the next day they had no sausage or mushrooms, and the egg yolks were hard. Just a big let down.

data.text: Came across these reviews and though I never post reviews I just had to say that myself, my husband and our adult daughter booked for Christmas day lunch 2017.  What a joke!  On arrival.. just old to take a seat and no-one came for half an hour ..like a funeral parlour. Whilst waiting we decided to buy a drink.  No welcome glass of bubbly...NO FESTIVE DECORATIONS ON THE TABLE. We had to ask for Christmas crackers.  No feeling of the day at all...not even festive music!  Cost something like ¬£70 but food was very average.  It used to be our favourite place for lunch for years but feel we were ripped off so won't ever be going again or make recommendations.  By the way, I wrote to management afterwards as we were all disappointed but got no reply.
data.name: Helena Fone
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Helena, We regret to hear that your Christmas day experience was not a positive one here at the Merlin. I can only presume crackers were forgotten of your table in haste of trying to get it relayed for you. As for the music, our music is controlled externally, however, i can assure you festive music was playing throughout our festive period.   As for your letter of concern, i can only apologize that this wasn't addressed as we strive to respond to all our feedback. With this is mind, We'd like the opportunity to discuss this with you. Please reach out to us at 01625 599959 to speak to the manager at your earliest convenience to discuss how we can restore your faith in the Merlin.  Leighanna and the team.

data.text: We visited on a Sunday night and there were only about 2 other tables occupied, but the service was quite slow although very friendly and it didn't matter too much to us as we weren't in a rush and gave us more time to catch up with friends. The ambience was nice and chilled, the music playlist was good and the decor is nice.  There is plenty of parking to the rear and a nice terrace to the front which is nice in the summer. The food was great, but people were looking forward to a roast which they had run out of so was a little disappointing. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, I think we were the last ones in and the time ran away from us but the staff didn't have a problem and were very accommodating. All in all nice restaurant and will definitely be returning.

data.text:
The place looks really nice. When I walked in at the 'greeting stand/place' there stood a staff member, middle aged woman glasses, who was actually the manager,
I had to stare at her for a bit to get her attention and then she looked at me as if to say 'what do you want'
I asked if there was a table for 2
"there's no room in the restaurant part, you can go and sit at the bar"
as she went straight back to whatever she was doing/ talking to another staff remember.... RUDE B  I thought.
our actual waitress was very nice.
I ordered the Trio Roast dinner
Got a plate with 2 slices of beef that was very tasty, a leg of chicken that was,,,,ok and a slice of pork that was emmm not the best... a couple of roast potatoes and a pretty small stuffing wrapped in bacon. my partner had the lamb roast, the lamb i tasted was extremely tough and chewy. she said some was nice, some was not.
set between us was one dish of cabbage and a couple of chunks of carrot, whist it was very very nice (covered in butter) I fell that it wasn't enough both for 2 and as extras to dinner.
Then I noticed the pork crackling was missing (comes with meal)so I had to re order that. now that was the nicest crackling ever!
however we also noticed that the sauces had not come and we had to re-order them too. I had a pint of cider and she had sparkling water, overall price was ¬£43. worth it? I really do not think so
If you are going to be paying over ¬£40 for lunch it should be a good lunch with good service. this was not . yes some of the food was good, but overall my conclusion is that we are never going there again.
data.name: stokey99

data.text:
Good food, ok prices.

I've been a few times in large groups (8+) and they don't seem to have enough staff in during the day.  Granted, we haven't made them aware  that we were coming, but last time it was one girl trying to wait on us whilst almost managing the bar
data.name: Ryan Freeman

data.text: Haven't been for 4 years. Went today and as fantastic as ever. Very busy but we weren't in a rush. Superb food and a great day out for us.
data.name: Stephen Perry

data.text:
I ate here by chance after a late business meeting and went for the Fillet Steak. Every bit of the food on the plate was absolutely gorgeous and the steak cooked to perfection.

It felt like I was waiting a little longer than expected, even taking into account that the food is obviously very high quality and freshly made, but it tasted so good that I had no problem with the slightly longer wait.

I'll definitely be going back here and will with my wife as well as friends. Overall a really relaxing atmosphere in the bar during our meeting, and free O2 wifi available.
data.name: Daniel Harris

data.text: We went to see Paul in June about a venue for my mum's 75th... Well we had impeccable personal service via email and face to face. The meal took.place on the 18th July,  we had a free private function room and the service was the best I've ever had, food was amazing, room amazing,service amazing, I couldn't fault a thing and we felt like we were the only ones in there who mattered. Thank you to Paul.
